title: Onboarding New Account via Branch deeplinks
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user does not have BP app installed previously (delete any/all instances from device)
AND user has been given a branch deeplink to access the app
custom_steps:
WHEN user accesses the deeplink 
AND user in directed to App store
AND user installed the app (13.2.0 or greater)
AND user creates a new account and completes onboarding
custom_expected:
THEN the deferred deep link resolves and user navigates to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link

** Examples: deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/cubs directs user to Cubs team page, while deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet directs user to Wallet page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses the deeplink on the mobile device browser (safari) - https://bp.mlb.com/cubs
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed to App store for MLB Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user installs BP* 


*Testflight build can be substituted since likely that desired version has not been released to AppleStore (after accessing the deeplink and being directed to the AppStore BP page, navigate to Testflight and install the release candidate build
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN BP app is installed on device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is presented with Redesigned Welcome Screen (Green field image in background)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User wants to onboard a new account*

*If 'Get Started' button shown, user taps button to get started w/ onboarding
*If 'Continue with MLB' button shown, user taps 'Sign Up' link below to get started w/ onboarding
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User is presented with Create an Account screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid data for all the fields
AND user submits 'Create Account'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/cubs was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Cubs team page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Remove BPP APP 

REPEAT steps 1 through 5, accessing a different branch deeplink that directs user to Home - https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Wallet page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Remove BPP APP 

REPEAT steps 1 through 5, accessing a different branch deeplink that directs user to Home - https://bp.mlb.com/BallparkHome
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/BallparkHome was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Home page)

title: Create an Account View - First/Last  Name text field validation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on the Create an Account page *(BPapp 13.2.0 or greater)

*[BP-9834](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9834 ) Regex

Prerequisite - Remote Config Setup for: regex_name_fields configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "regex_name_fields" as needed to force display. 
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.

BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobiletools-npd-d08e/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform)
custom_steps:
NOTE: Create an Account page can be reached via following, and for complete test coverage should be verified from each point of entry:
*Fresh installation (without keychain) > Get Started button
*Fresh installation (without keychain) > Have an account? Log in link > Sign Up link
*Upgraded installation (with keychain) > Sign Up link
*Upgraded installation (with keychain) > Log In with another MLB account link > Sign Up link

Additionally: First and Last name can be any character that is allowed in the RemoteConfig Regex

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user views the Create an Account page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Create an Account' header is shown at the top of the page
AND 'Create an MLB account to purchase and access your digital tickets for all MLB Ballparks.' is shown
AND Email Address, Password, First Name, Last Name, Birthdate fields are presented
AND all text fields are unpopulated
AND a radio button is enabled by default under the text fields with 'I would like to receive newsletters and promotions from MLB.com and its partners.'
AND 'By signing up, I understand and agree to be bound by the MLB.com Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.' text is shown below the radio button
AND 'Terms of Use' and 'Privacy Policy' are links within the text
AND 'Create Account' button is shown below the terms and privacy verbiage
AND 'Already have an Account? Log In' text is shown below the Create Acct button ('Log In' is a link within the text)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a First name with 40+ characters
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error is displayed "Invalid First Name entered" 
AND the message will be in Red Font
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a Last name with 40+ characters
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error is displayed "Invalid Last Name entered" 
AND the message will be in Red Font
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a First/Last having multiple names and/or hyphenate(allowed in the Regex config value), such as:
*Vlad Guerrero Jr.
*Michael Harris II
*Byung-Hyun Kim
*Isiah Kiner-Falefa
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error is NOT displayed (as long the characters are allowed via Regex configuration)
AND the account creation is allowed

title: First/Last  Name text field validation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on the Create an MLB account Sign Up page

*[BP-9834](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9834 ) Regex

Prerequisite - Remote Config Setup for: regex_name_fields configuration
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "regex_name_fields" as needed to force display. 
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.

BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobiletools-npd-d08e/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform)
custom_steps:
NOTE: Sign Up page can be reached via following, and for complete test coverage should be verified from each point of entry:
*Fresh installation (without keychain) > Get Started button
*Fresh installation (without keychain) > Have an account? Log in link > Sign Up link
*Upgraded installation (with keychain) > Sign Up link
*Upgraded installation (with keychain) > Log In with another MLB account link > Sign Up link

Additionally: First and Last name can be any character that is allowed in the RemoteConfig Regex

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user views the Sign Up page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Create an MLB account to access your digital tickets.' modal is shown
AND 'X' is shown at the top right corner to dismiss the view
AND all text fields are unpopulated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a First name with 40+ characters
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error is displayed "Character limit of 40 reached." 
AND the message will be in Red Font
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a Last name with 40+ characters
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error is displayed "Character limit of 40 reached." 
AND the message will be in Red Font
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a First/Last having multiple names and/or hyphenate(allowed in the Regex config value), such as:
*Vlad Guerrero Jr.
*Michael Harris II
*Byung-Hyun Kim
*Isiah Kiner-Falefa
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error is NOT displayed (as long the characters are allowed via Regex configuration)
AND the account creation is allowed

custom_preconds:
[BP-10186](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10186 )
Note: For iPhone to create and store passwords, iCloud Keychain must be turned on. 
*Go to Settings > [your name] > iCloud > Keychain. (extracted from [Automatically fill in strong passwords on iPhone](https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/automatically-fill-in-strong-passwords-iphf9219d8c9/15.0/ios/15.0 ) )
*Go to Settings > Passwords> AutoFill Passwords. Enable 'AutoFill Passwords' toggle AND ensure 'iCloud KeyChain' has check

GIVEN user is on the Create an MLB account Sign Up page*


*Strong Password Suggestion introduced with 12.1.9 BP
*Strong Password Suggestion doesn't work on the simulator, so we can't create a UI test for the specific feature

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user views the Sign Up page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Create an MLB account to access your digital tickets.' modal is shown
AND 'X' is shown at the top right corner to dismiss the view
AND all text fields are unpopulated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters a valid email address 
AND taps into password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed an iPhone-created strong password 
AND the password field displays 'Strong Password' at the end of the field, w/ beginning of password shown (and then fades to no longer display)
AND the password requirements (i.e 1 number/uppercase/lowercase, 8-15 chars, No special char) have all been satisfied 
AND user is presented a bottom sheet 'iPhone created a strong password for this app.' with two options
*Use Strong Password
*Other Options...

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps 'Use Strong Password' option presented in the bottom sheet
AND the user enters valid data for all other fields
AND the email entered does not have a previous MLB account
AND the user taps Sign Up button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account is created successfully 
AND that password is saved via keychain
AND the user is shown the Home Page

Note: A prompt may be shown to allow Ballpark to track activities
Note: A prompt may also be shown to allow Notifications

title: Submit button - Reset Password View
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on the Reset Password page

[THIS CASE REQUIRES A PASSWORD CHANGE TO OCCUR - IT IS BEST TO ONBOARD A NEW ACCT WITH A VALID EMAIL ADDRESS, TO PREVENT CHANGING PW ON SHARED TEST ACCOUNTS]
custom_steps:
NOTE: Reset Password page can be reached via following, and therefore should be verified from each point of entry:
*Fresh installation (without keychain) > Have an account? Log in link > Forgot Password link
*Upgraded installation (with keychain) > Log In with another MLB account link > Forgot Password link

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Forgot Password link from the Log In page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Reset Password' modal is shown
AND 'X' is shown at the top right corner to dismiss the view
AND 'Please enter your MLB account email address. We'll send you an email with a link to reset your password.' text is shown
AND email field is shown beneath the instructive text
AND email field is unpopulated
And 'Submit' button is shown, but disabled
AND a back nav arrow is shown at the top left

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND the user taps Submit button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND the email field and submit button are no longer shown, INSTEAD is shown "Reset password instructions have been sent to your email."

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses their email containing a Reset Password link
AND user completes needed actions to successfully reset the password
AND user returns to BP app (Reset Password page, if prev minimized)
AND user logs in with new password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is logged in successfully with newly reset password.
